title: AngularJS Vs. React - Pros & Cons
desc: Choosing the best framework in is not an easy task. Front-end frameworks are growing in popularity as they allow individuals and companies alike to build complex applications in reduced time. These technologies continue to evolve and have revolutionized the world of web development. Today, we will compare three popular front-end technologies: React and Angular. Today, we will ntroducing the frameworks and break down each framework so that you will get a feel of which one feels right for you.
about: Misko Hevery, 34 years old from Sydney Australia, is an experienced fremaworks developer who created a full series of lessons about AngularJS and React frameworks for beginners and is considered one of the best in the field in Sydney.

title: Some Simple Rules for a Perfect Coding
desc: Good code can be identified as code that is easy to read, understand, debug, and modify, and most importantly has very few defects. Obviously it takes a bit more time to write good code, but it also has more value in the long term, because it costs less to maintain and is more reusable. Code might accomplish your short term goals as a programmer working on a specific feature, but if no one else wants to reuse it must be lacking in some way. It this lecture I will provide some tips from my own experience, waiting to see you there!
about: Denis Robbins, 35 years old from San Francisco California, is an experienced full-stack developer who created a full series of lessons about JavaScript frameworks for beginners and is considered one of the best in the field in San Francisco.

title: Building a Customer Care Dream-Team
desc: News of bad customer service reaches more than twice as many ears as praise for good service. With word of mouth spreading like wildfire over social media, your reputation is in customers’ hands. Our team members are hired with the expectation that they will work in the best interest of our customers. Everyone is given the tools and authority to make decisions. In this lecture, we will talk about how to hire motivated employees (They’ve got the will, you train the skill.), empower employees, create trust, and dream BIG.
about: Amber McCarthy, 33 years old from Edinburgh Scotland, is an experienced Customer Support agents manager who created a full series of lessons about Custome Success best practices for scaling startups and is considered one of the best in the field in Edinburgh.

title: Building a Successful Sales Team
desc: Building a successful Sales team is not easy,  and it is definitely one of the most important things companies need to invest in to gain success. In this lecture, we will break down the 5 most important fundamentals in this field: Don’t be afraid to ask for help. Do the research. Have a good hiring process. Don’t just fire fast. Fire lightning fast. Use ‘must-have’ tools to help your team succeed. Looking forward to seeing you at the event! Join the event to learn how to build a successful Sales team for your organization.
about: John Armis, 42 years old from Prague Czech Republic, is an experienced Sales and Business Development expert who created a full series of lessons about Sales and BD practices for scaling startups and is considered one of the best in the field in Prague.

title: Copy, Micro-Copy and Your Content Strategy
desc: It is especially true with web content - small things can make a big difference. The shortest of phrases and even single words - coupled with how they are designed and where they are or are not placed on a page can affect the user experience. This is where microcopy comes in, these small snippets of text can help guide users through a process, such as completing a form or placing an order. But, so often, this important content is an afterthought. In this lecture, we will break down content and Copy rules to make a real difference.
about: Sarah Parmon, 52 years old from Copenhagen Denmark, is an experienced Content Development manager who created a full series of lessons about how to write the perfect piece of content best practices for marketing teams and is considered one of the best in the field in Copenhagen.

title: Creating Organization Leadership Program
desc: Leaders can be nurtured and developed, but not manufactured. When creating a leadership development program, think about how you can place participants into situations that will require them to learn and grow. Examples include giving candidates the opportunity to step up when other leaders are away or to collaborate with colleagues in other departments on a special project. Mentoring, training and organizational planning, with individual activities such as job rotation, job shadowing and project leadership, are often components of effective leadership development programs. In this lecture, we will learn how to identify potential leaders. Waiting to see you there.
about: Richard Cooper, 43 years old from London England, is an experienced Organizational Consultant who created a full series of lessons about how companies can scale and grow the right way, he is considered one of the best in the field in London.

title: Fast Recovering from Wrong Decision Making
desc: Fast Recovering from Wrong Decision Making is definitely a life-skill, coming with the need to take full responsibility. The first step you must take when having made a poor choice is to recognize the part you played in a situation. It does no good at all to make excuses or rationalize or pretend that, for whatever reason, you aren't to blame. If you want to move forward from wherever you've found yourself, you have to take responsibility for your choices and actions. Keep in mind that this is not a time to think of excuses for why it happened; this is a time to understand why it happened so you can avoid making similar decisions in the future. In this lecture, we will also learn how to apologize and explain, focus on the present and be proactive in the future.
about: Dr. Karen McGrine, 58 years old from London England, is an experienced business psychologist who wrote a full series of books about Business decision making and is considered one of the most appreciated psychologists in the field in London.

title: How SEO & PPC Supports Each Other
desc: Many people approach SEO and PPC as completely separate strategies. Well, they are very wrong. And while they are different in many ways, it can be helpful to think of SEO and PPC as being two sides of the same coin: Search. There are many ways in which SEO and PPC efforts complement each other, and lead to a more successful search strategy. Consider these eight ways that make a coordinated SEO and PPC strategy greater than the sum of its parts. In this lecture we will learn about the things guiding us; Visibility, keyword data, how to use Best Performing PPC Ad Copy to Inform Your Organic Content Strategy.
about: Neil Dosson, 28 years old from San Francisco California, is an experienced Marketing Manager who created a full series of lessons about how to do Online Marketing for scaling startups as well as enterprises in the Tech industry and is considered one of the best in the field in London.

title: How to Build Manager Self-Awareness
desc: For most of us, it’s an ongoing process. Whether you’re a seasoned manager or relatively new to the ranks, you may have learned the hard way that the skills that helped you move up the ladder aren’t necessarily the skills you need for successful leadership. It's not unusual to see new managers stumble early on as they stretch beyond their previous roles. Perhaps stellar technical skills helped you get a promotion to team lead, but in a managerial role you'll be relying much more heavily on interpersonal communication skills. In this lecture, we will talk about your ability to affect change and how it is ultimately dependent on relationships and networks.
about: Dr. James Davis,  55 years old from London England, is an experienced Psychologist who wrote a full series of books about Business decision making and is considered one of the most appreciated psychologists in the field in London.

title: How to Master SAAS Social Media Marketing
desc: Ever wondered how the world's biggest SaaS B2B businesses are acting on their social media marketing plans? What are the most known SaaS businesses doing? As a B2B business, in order to build an effective social media marketing plan, you should ask yourself a few fundamental questions before you start doing anything. Many beginner B2B business owners rush into doing their marketing and forget about really understanding what their core business value is, their position on the market, and what problem they are actually trying to solve. In this lecture, we are going to see how things can be done differently by analyzing the top trends in SaaS Social Media Marketing for your business!
about: Simon Collison, 36 years old from San Francisco California, is an experienced Social Media Marketing Manager who created a full series of lessons about how to do Social Media Marketing for scaling startups as well as enterprises in the Tech industry and is considered one of the best in the field in London.

title: How to Effectively Market your Awesome Product
desc: In this lecture, we will talk about some of the great online strategies to market a product online. Take Email-Marketing, for example, email is one of the most consistently effective channels for acquiring new customers and while channels like search can take a while to start generating organic traffic, email marketing can start working right away. There’s no need to spend all your time writing and sending emails. Make it easy on yourself by setting up a collection of automated email campaigns that are designed to increase your revenue. There are many options available, join the event to hear more about the strongest online marketing tools out there.
about: Cameron Mollins, 36 years old from London England, is an experienced Product Marketing Manager who created a full series of lessons about how to do a proper Product Marketing for scaling startups as well as enterprises in the Tech industry and is considered one of the best in the field in London.

title: How to Successfully Manage your Manager
desc: Your manager is your daily contact person. They guide and assess your work and have considerable power over your future in the company. To turn them into an ally and stop them taking the wind out of your sails, it’s essential to build a healthy relationship with them. A manager is a person just like anyone else: they learn, make mistakes, and need your help to grow. Use every opportunity to give feedback (both positive and negative) to help them in this process. In this lecture, we will talk about the different types of managers how to approach each and every one of them. Waiting to see you at the event.
about: Tim Posner,  47 years old from London England, is an experienced Psychologist who wrote a full series of books about Business decision making and is considered one of the most appreciated psychologists in the field in London.

title: How to Deal with a Problematic Customer
desc: Crossed arms, heavy sighs, short replies -- you know when a customer's getting frustrated. Worse, these physical signs show they're losing interest in what you're saying, and your shot at keeping their business might be fading fast. Often, difficult or even angry customers aren't expressing frustration with you. These emotions are tied to external situations and psychological stimuli. So, put your great communication skills to work, draw on your superpower of reading the situation, and use these seven psychological tips for managing difficult customers to save your customer from churning. In this lecture, we will learn a bit more about our superpower... See you at the event!
about: Sheila Moore, 45 years old from San Francisco California, is an experienced Customer Support agents manager who created a full series of lessons about Custome Success best practices for scaling startups and is considered one of the best in the field in San Francisco.

title: Learn from Others' Tech Career Failures
desc: Failure and fault are virtually inseparable in most households, organizations, and cultures. Every child learns at some point that admitting failure means taking the blame. That is why so few organizations have shifted to a culture of psychological safety in which the rewards of learning from failure can be fully realized. Executives from all industries admit to being torn: How can they respond constructively to failures without giving rise to an anything-goes attitude? If people aren’t blamed for failures, what will ensure that they try as hard as possible to do their best work? Join the lecture to learn more about how to learn from others' career failures.
about: Prof. Brenda Seligman, 67 years old from London England, is an experienced Psychologist who wrote a full series of books about  career decision making and is considered one of the most appreciated psychologists in the field in London.

title: Mastering HTML & CSS in 60 Minutes
desc: HTML, HyperText Markup Language, gives content structure and meaning by defining that content as, for example, headings, paragraphs, or images. CSS, or Cascading Style Sheets, is a presentation language created to style the appearance of content—using, for example, fonts or colors. The two languages HTML and CSS are independent of one another and should remain that way. CSS should not be written inside of an HTML document and vice versa. As a rule, HTML will always represent content, and CSS will always represent the appearance of that content. With this understanding of the difference between HTML and CSS, let’s dive into HTML in more detail. In the event we will break down everything needed to build a designed HTML page using CSS.
about: Gilka Mesker, 31 years old from New Delhi India, is an experienced full-stack developer who created a full series of lessons about HTML and CSS for beginners and is considered one of the best in the field in New Delhi.

title: Node, APIs, and all the REST
desc: Congrats! You just made your first useless express server! So let’s go through the code and learn why our server is useless and why it’s not implementing the REST protocol yet. The first line requires express and uses the express variable to represent it. The second line initialized express using the brackets which initializes an express server and puts the initialized server into the variable app. So now whenever we want to use our express server, we would need to use the app variable which represents our app! We then set our app to listen to port 3000 and create a callback function that says our server is running on port 3000. Join the event to continue the lesson!
about: Miles Thompson,  39 years old from San Francisco California,  is an experienced full-stack developer who created a full series of lessons about using NodeJS, APIs and more for beginners and is considered one of the best in the field in San Francisco.

title: Overcome Creativity Blockers at Work
desc: For a creative professional, a creative block isn’t just frustrating — it’s potentially career-damaging. When you rely on your creativity to pay the bills and build your reputation, you can’t afford to be short of ideas or the energy to put them into action. But all creative blocks are not created equal. Different types of block require different solutions - something that’s easily forgotten when you’re feeling stuck. Here are seven of the most common types, and how to unblock them. Join the event to learn how to overcome creativity blockers at work.
about: Ethan Marcotte, 30 years old from Paris France, Eitan Marcota, 30, from Paris, France, is a trainer and creator of a unique course that allows you to illustrate and get out of the box, where to get inspired and how to create it for yourself. In addition, Ethan teaches how to properly manage time at work in front of multiple interfaces so as not to go out of concentration.

title: So, What's Really New With Vue?
desc: The team at Vue released the latest and most exciting version of Vue CLI. This version was a re-write of the prototyping and scaffolding tool, going back to why Vue was built in the first place: ease of use. The need to re-write the CLI tool came mostly from the fact that developers struggled with a lot of configurations while trying to setup Vue projects. There was also this push to bring about even more clarity about setting up tools at the start of any Vue project. With the new CLI version, you do not really need a full fledged project with all the configs. Sometimes, you just want to work on a single component and see it run on a local development server. Good news! the new Vue CLI lets you do exactly that. Join the event to learn more.
about: Evan You, 33 years old from San Francisco California, is an experienced full-stack developer who created the successful VueJS framework that is being used by developers around the world. Evan, in some way, changed the world of JS and is considered one of the best in the field.

title: Starting a Tech Career? Let's Talk About It
desc: Want to land a tech job? Better start spending hours reading dozens of tech blogs and following hundreds of influencers, right? Wrong. Because let’s be real: No company is going to hire you simply for being addicted to the internet. What they’re really looking for is someone knowledgeable about the handful of things that matter. And that’s a good thing, because it’ll save you from spending hours trying to be an expert on everything. So, as with every aspect of the job search, it’s critical that you apply the rule and focus on just the most important online resources that’ll actually get you closer to your dream job. Join the event to get the basics of how to successfully land a Tech job.
about: Martin Pinker, 44 years old from San Francisco California, is an experienced Human Resources manager in the Tech industry who helped to build great teams for startups as well as enterprises in the Tech industry and is considered one of the best in the field in San Francisco.

title: The Coming Future of B2B Marketing
desc: As marketers, we can measure almost everything. But we have to be careful, because, as the quote goes, ,Not everything that counts can be counted, and not everything that can be counted counts., For instance, we should allow cost-per-click and click-through rate to fall by the wayside for more significant metrics that measure the actual contribution of marketing throughout the funnel. In the upper funnel, for example, marketers should measure brand awareness. In the mid-funnel, we should measure content engagement. And in the lower funnel, we should measure lead generation and sales conversion - both of which give a window on marketing’s very real contribution to revenue. Join the event to learn about the new B2B Marketing metrics.
about: Phillip Schiller, 60 years old from San Francisco California, is an experienced Marketer who held some very important roles at the biggest companies out there, such as VP Marketing, VP of Product Marketing at and Director of Product Marketing. In his events, he loves talking about his history, how to do a proper Product Marketing for scaling startups as well as enterprises in the Tech industry. He is considered one of the best in the field around the world.

title: The Grand History of JavaScript
desc: It all happened in six months from May to December 1995. Netscape Communications Corporation had a strong presence in the young web. Its browser, Netscape Communicator, was gaining traction as a competitor to NCSA Mosaic, the first popular web browser. Netscape was founded by the very same people that took part in the development of Mosaic during the early 90s, and now, with money and independence, they had the necessary freedom to seek further ways to expand the web. And that is precisely what gave birth to JavaScript. Join the event to get a brief history of JavaScript.
about: Samer Ahmed, 37 years old from London England, is an experienced Marketing Manager who created a full series of lessons about how to do Online Marketing for scaling startups as well as enterprises in the Tech industry and is considered one of the best in the field in London.

title: The Next Generation of Customer Support
desc: When asking what do customers care about more than the purchase of a product? The answer is clear - The Experience. Remarkable customer experiences are now about more than just your product. Today’s customers prefer to interact with companies via digital channels and they expect a personal touch if they have a problem. Today’s customer has become much more comfortable and proficient with digital technologies. Most now prefer to interact with each other and with the companies they do businesses with via digital channels, and they expect the same level of personal touch when they have a problem. Join the events to learn how to nail the barriers of customer support using new technologies.
about: Mikkel Svane, 46 years old from Stockholm Sweden, is an experienced Customer Support agents manager who created a full series of lessons about Custome Success best practices for scaling startups and is considered one of the best in the field in Stockholm.

title: Time to Learn Some Sass Tricks & Hacks
desc: Getting your site structure correct from the beginning is vital for any new Sass project. Using partials allows you to break the CSS up into smaller more manageable blocks of code that are easier to maintain and develop. The purpose of Sass is to write cleaner more manageable CSS. Before creating any new mixins, variables, or functions, ensure that their presence will enhance development and not overcomplicate things. All Sass features are useful when used in the correct situations and in moderation. Avoid creating an endless list of variables without clear usage, or a complex function that is difficult to understand for anyone other than the author, this will not aid development or produce DRY CSS. Join the event to learn about how to you Sass the right way and discover some tricks and hacks.
about: Chris Coyier, 29 years old from Madrid Spain, is an experienced Project Manager and a talented UX Expert in the eCommerce field who created a full series of lessons about User Experience best practices for scaling startups and is considered one of the best in the field in Madrid.

title: Why Diversity is a Real Organization Power
desc: Workplace diversity fosters mutual respect among employees. Whether employees work in groups or teams comprised of co-workers with varied work styles, disabilities or who represent different cultures or generations, a synergistic work environment becomes the norm. Although an idyllic atmosphere may be difficult to achieve, employees nevertheless recognize the many strengths and talents that diversity brings to the workplace and they gain respect for their colleagues’ performance. Join the event to open you mind.
about: Steven Huang, 40 years old from Amsterdam Netherlands, is an experienced Human Resources manager in the Tech industry who helped to build great teams for startups as well as enterprises in the Tech industry and is considered one of the best in the field in Amsterdam.

title: Why Executive Social Media Presence Matters
desc: looking to convince senior management of the relevance of their interactions on social media, are usually confronted with a reaction that goes a little something like this: “Social media is for private use only and looks unprofessional!” However, accessibility and interaction on social networks are more important than ever for companies - and that goes for senior managers too. Why should executives be active on social media channels and how can executives benefit from online presence? The answer is simple: “Successful executives will be measured by more than their stock price in the future.” Waiting to see you at the event, and invite those executives as well!

title: How to Prepare Yourself for a Sales Career
desc: You’re attracted to the idea of a career in sales. Perhaps you have friends or relatives who are enjoying, and being successful in, a sales career. Perhaps you’ve heard of the fortunes that can be made in a sales job. Or maybe it’s just that you’re fed up with your own job, and you’re considering sales as one of a number of possible career options? Whichever is the case, here are a number of issues to think about, and a few things you can do to prepare for your first interview for a sales position. Join the event to share re some thoughts!
about: Maria Pedro,  36 years old from Sao Paulo Brazil, is an experienced Sales and Business Development expert who created a full series of lessons about Sales and BD practices for scaling startups and is considered one of the best in the field in Sao Paulo.

title: How to Overcome Sales Objections the Smart Way
desc: Sales objection is a rebuttal from your current lead during the sales process that explicitly states a reason why they will not be buying from you at the moment. These can include problems with price, usefulness of the product, or a lack of time to engage with you currently, among other things. Here’s one important thing every seasoned salesperson understands: For you, the salesperson, a sales objection is an opportunity to learn more about your prospect’s needs, and find better ways to communicate the value your solution has to offer to them. Join the events to learn more.
about: Albert Muller,  38 years old from Berlin Germany, is an experienced Sales and Business Development expert who created a full series of lessons about Sales and BD practices for scaling startups and is considered one of the best in the field in Berlin.

title: Online Sales and the Shopping Experience
desc: Being online is a must for product sellers. 69% of people prefer to make their purchases online, and online retailers will be the first research preference for 66% of buyers. That being said, introducing yourself to e-commerce is not a fast and easy task, but an adventure that must be constantly improved, paying attention to changes, trends and patterns of users’ online behavior. What’s the solution to a low number of online visits and purchases, a high number of product returns or shopping  cart abandonment? Join the lecture to hear all about it.
about: Gretel Zigler,  35 years old from Berlin Germany, is an experienced Project Manager and a talented UX Expert in the eCommerce field who created a full series of lessons about User Experience best practices for scaling startups and is considered one of the best in the field in Berlin.
